spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The aboleth's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The deva has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The deva makes two attacks.

action.name: Celestial Hammer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 17 ({@damage 5d6}) radiant damage. On a hit, the target can't make opportunityattacks against the deva until the beginning of the target's next turn.

bonus.name: Bonus
entries: Entries

reaction.name: Self-Sacrifice
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of the thrall that the thrall can see hits an aboleth with an attack, the thrall can make itself the target of the attack instead.

legendary.name: Legendary action
entries: Entries for legendary action

monster.name: BEAR
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak, aside from a few prerecorded lines, usually ordering compliance

trait.name: Magic Capacitor
entries: The BEAR has an internal adaptive capacitor which can hold one charge. When the BEAR fails a saving throw against a spell or other magical effect, it can choose to absorb the magic, gain a charge, and instead succeed the saving throw. The BEAR can expend this charge to activate certain bonus actions, but until it does it cannot use this trait again.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The BEAR's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Merciful Wind
entries: When the BEAR reduces a creature to 0 HP, it can choose to knock the creature out, leaving it {@condition unconscious} and stable.

trait.name: Unyielding
entries: The BEAR cannot be pushed, pulled, or affected by teleportation or planar travel unless it wishes to be.

trait.name: Technological Weakness
entries: Whenever a creature proficient in Engineering enters combat with a hostile BEAR, it knows that the BEAR has a weakness. As a bonus action, the creature can make a {@dc 14} Engineering check, having the DM read out the BEAR's Precarious Complexity trait on a success.

trait.name: Precarious Complexity
entries: At the start of the BEAR's turn, if it took damage from four or more types since the start of its previous turn, it seizes briefly. Its capacitor loses its charge and ceases to function for one hour, and the BEAR cannot use any of its recharge abilities this turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The BEAR makes two attacks.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}37 ({@damage 5d12 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Integrated Semi-Automatic Firearm
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}37 ({@damage 5d12 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Ground Pound (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The BEAR Disengages, then jumps up to 30 feet. Each Large or smaller creature of the BEAR's choice within 5 feet of it must succeed a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 37 ({@damage 5d12 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. On a successful save, the creature takes only half damage, and it is not knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Precision Targeting (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The BEAR chooses any number of creatures within a 30-foot cone. Each of those creatures must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking 37 ({@damage 5d12 + 5}) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Overclock
entries: The BEAR expends the charge of its capacitor; it recharges Ground Pound and Precision Targeting and, until the start of its next turn, it has advantage on attack rolls, creatures have disadvantage on saving throws against its abilities, and it deals 2 ({@damage 1d4}) extra lightning damage whenever it deals damage to a creature.

bonus.name: Thrusters
entries: The BEAR expends the charge of its capacitor and flies 60 feet; it can hover until the start of its next turn.

monster.name: Brass Man

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't adamantine

languages: understands common and primordial but can't speak

trait.name: Aligned Senses
entries: Increase the passive Perception of all brass men within 3 miles of each other by +1 for each brass man after the first.

trait.name: Coordinated Tactics
entries: During the turn of multiple brass men, each can move independently but must take the same standard action; if a given brass man cannot take the same standard action as its peers, it takes no standard action. Likewise, they must take the same bonus action (typically to reload their muskets). Brass men cannot take reactions.

trait.name: Shared Will
entries: Brass men have advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.

trait.name: Technological Weakness
entries: Whenever a creature proficient in Insight enters combat with a hostile brass man, it knows that the brass man has a weakness. As a bonus action, the creature can make a {@dc 12} Insight check, having the DM read out the brass man's Peer Pressure trait on a success.

trait.name: Peer Pressure
entries: If the brass man fails an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw, the consequence also affects all other brass men within 3 miles.

action.name: Metal Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Musket
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 60/180 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage. The brass man must use an action or bonus action to reload the musket before firing it again. If the brass man rolls a natural 1 on an attack roll with the musket, the barrel is fouled, causing future attacks to have disadvantage until the brass man spends an action to clear the barrel. Rolling a natural 1 on an attack roll with a fouled barrel causes the weapon to explode, dealing 18 ({@damage 4d8}) piercing damage to the brass man.

trait.name: Golden Gravity
entries: Hostile creatures that start their turn or move within 10 feet of the elephant must succeed a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or else have their speed reduced to 0 and be unable to teleport until the start of their next turn.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the elephant moves at least 20 feet straight towards a creature and then hit it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the elephant can make one stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Technological Weakness
entries: Whenever a creature proficient in Medicine enters combat with a hostile elephant, it knows that the elephant has a weakness. As a bonus action, the creature can make a {@dc 13} Medicine check, having the DM read out the elephant's Reject Graft trait on a success.

trait.name: Reject Graft
entries: When magic heals any of the elephant's hit point damage, the elephant chooses one of the following abilities, which stops working until the elephant completes a long rest: Damage Resistance, Farslayer Tusks, or Gale Shield.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition prone} creature. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Farslayer Tusks
entries: The elephant chooses a creature within 150 feet. That creature must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. It takes 19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) piercing damage, or half as much on a successful save.

reaction.name: Gale Shield
entries: When a creature hits the elephant or a creature adjacent to it with a ranged weapon attack, the elephant can use its reaction to reduce the damage by 17 ({@damage 1d10 + 12}). If this causes the attack to deal no damage, the elephant can immediately make the following attack with the projectile. {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d12 - 1}) damage of a type based on the projectile.

monster.name: Family Bravura
languages: one more based on the bravura's race

trait.name: Part of the Family
entries: When an attack reduces the bravura to 0 hit points, one ally of the bravura with this same trait who can sense the attacker can use its reaction to move its Speed, then can make an attack against the creature that knocked the bravura out.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Pistol
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d10}) piercing damage. The weapon misfires on a natural 1 (see Adventures in Zeitgeist page 79). Reloading requires an action or bonus action before this attack can be made again.

monster.name: Kuchnost Strangler
languages: one more based on the strangler's race

trait.name: Close Quarters Combat
entries: Whenever an adjacent creature misses with an attack against the strangler when they had disadvantage on their attack roll, the strangler can use its reaction to make the attacker deal 2 ({@damage 1d4}) damage to itself, using its own weapon.

action.name: Knife
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Strangle
entries: The strangler uses the {@spell Grapple|LevelUp} maneuver on a creature. If it succeeds, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) bludgeoning damage. While {@condition grappled}, the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls against the strangler.

monster.name: Family Capodecina
languages: one more based on the capo's race

trait.name: Part of the Family
entries: When an attack reduces the capo to 0 hit points, one ally of the capo with this same trait who can sense the attacker can use its reaction to move its Speed, then can make an attack against the creature that knocked the capo out.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Once per turn the capo can deal an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) damage to one creature it hits with an attack if it has advantage on the attack roll. It doesn't need advantage if one of the capo's allies is adjacent to the target, as long as the capo doesn't have disadvantage on the attack.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Disappear in a Crowd
entries: If the capo has two enemies within 10 feet, it makes a Stealth check to hide against them. Then it can either Dash or use Shortsword.

bonus.name: Sudden Disappearance (1/Encounter)
entries: The capo and each ally within 20 feet turns {@condition invisible} until the start of the capo's next turn. If one of those creatures attack, the invisibility ends for that creature.

reaction.name: Sly Maneuver
entries: When a creature attacks the capo, if the capo is adjacent to any creatures other than the attacker, the attacker makes a Wisdom saving throw ({@dc 13}). If it fails, the attack targets one of those other creatures instead. If there are more than one, the capo decides who is hit.

monster.name: Kuchnost Negotiator
languages: one more based on the negotiator's race

trait.name: Close Quarters Combat
entries: Whenever an adjacent creature misses with an attack against the negotiator when they had disadvantage on their attack roll, the negotiator can use its reaction to make the attacker deal 2 ({@damage 1d4}) damage to itself, using its own weapon.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The negotiator makes two attacks.

action.name: Dirty Fighting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage, and the target makes a Constitution saving throw ({@dc 13}). If it fails, it's {@condition blinded} until the start of the negotiator's next turn.

action.name: Shotgun
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d10 + 1}) piercing damage. The weapon misfires on a natural 1 (see Adventures in Zeitgeist page 79). Reloading requires an action or bonus action before this attack can be used again. If the attack has advantage and both rolls hit, it deals an extra 6 ({@damage 1d10}) damage. If it has disadvantage and hits with at least one, the graze still deals 2 ({@damage 1d4}) damage.

action.name: Fight Amongst Yourselves (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The negotiator chooses a spot within 30 feet. Each enemy within 10 feet of that spot makes a Wisdom saving throw ({@dc 13}). If it fails, it is goaded for one minute. While goaded, it has disadvantage on attack rolls except against its own allies. This effect ends immediately if it deals damage to an ally.

monster.name: Last Raven Fetch
languages: one more based on the fetch's race

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Raven's Perch (1/Day)
entries: The fetch chooses a creature within 30 feet. That creature is {@condition grappled} by a summoned shadowy raven. The raven's grapple persists until it dies or is removed, at which it disappears.

The raven has 1 hit point, AC 12, a Maneuver DC of 12, an Athletics check bonus of +4, and otherwise has a +0 bonus on all die rolls. It can grapple creatures as if it were Medium size. On the fetch's turn it can have the raven fly with speed 20 as a free action, potentially dragging or even flying off with the creature it has {@condition grappled}.

bonus.name: Raven's Hex (1/Day)
entries: The fetch casts {@spell hex|LevelUp}.

monster.name: Last Raven Rooker
languages: one more based on the rooker's race

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Swooping Familiar
entries: The rooker chooses a path up to 120 feet long, which starts at her space and then returns to her. Her familiar flies that route and makes the following attack against up to three targets along the path. The flight doesn't provoke opportunity attacks, and the familiar cannot be attacked separately. {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., up to three targets. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage. If the rooker is hidden when she makes these attacks, the attack does not reveal her location, though people can possibly guess based on the path of the familiar's flight.

action.name: Curse of the Mage's Shadow (1/Day)
entries: The rooker chooses a creature within 30 feet that she has cast {@spell hex|LevelUp} on. As long as the creature remains hexed, whenever it attempts to cast a spell, it makes an opposed Arcana check against the rooker. If it fails, that creature's spell has no effect, and the rooker can use her reaction to cast the spell.

bonus.name: Raven's Hex (1/Day)
entries: The rooker casts {@spell hex|LevelUp}.

monster.name: Police Officer
languages: one based on the officer's race

trait.name: Home Advantage
entries: Due to familiarity with their home community, the officer can use their reaction when targeted by a ranged or area attack to move 5 feet or to drop {@condition prone}, which might grant them cover against the attack. This can only be done when the officer is within their home community.

action.name: Billy Club
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Pistol
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d10}) piercing damage. The weapon misfires on a natural 1 (see Adventures in Zeitgeist page 79). Reloading requires an action or bonus action before this attack can be made again.

trait.name: Fighting Unit
entries: The squad consists of 10 {@creature police officer|LevelUp|officers} working in tandem, filling the space of a single Large creature. Enemies treat spaces within 5 feet of the squad as difficult terrain. The squad can make up to four opportunity attacks per round without using its reaction.
Effects that affect an area deal double damage to the squad if they include 2 spaces of the unit, or triple if they include the squad's entire space.
Non-damaging effects that target only a single creature usually have no effect on the squad. The DM should use their best judgment when adjudicating such effects.
Damage to the squad wounds individuals and weakens squad cohesion. Defeated individuals typically are back in fighting shape after a long rest.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The squad makes two attacks.

action.name: Subdue with Clubs
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Pistol
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d10}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Fighting Unit
entries: The troop consists of 25 {@creature police officer|LevelUp|officers} working in tandem, filling the space of a single Huge creature. Enemies treat spaces within 5 feet of the troop as difficult terrain. The troop can make up to four opportunity attacks per round without using its reaction.
Effects that affect an area deal double damage to the troop if they include 2 spaces of the unit, or triple if they include the troop's entire space.
Non-damaging effects that target only a single creature usually have no effect on the troop. The DM should use their best judgment when adjudicating such effects.
Damage to the troop wounds individuals and weakens troop cohesion. Defeated individuals typically are back in fighting shape after a long rest.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The troop makes four attacks.

action.name: Blades and Bludgeons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage.

action.name: Muskets
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 60/180 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d8 + 1}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The rangale's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Hands-Off
entries: The rangale cannot be disarmed, as it does not need limbs to wield its weapons.

trait.name: Overbearing Watch
entries: The rangale can spend a bonus action to magically mark a foe within 90 feet for one hour. Its attacks against that target deal an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage, it has advantage on Wisdom checks to find it, and it can cast any of its innate spells to target that creature from any range. If it uses this ability again, the previous mark lapses.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rangale attacks three times.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 15 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Retrieving Bow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage. The rangale pulls the target up to 50 feet towards it. If the creature succeeds a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw, the rangale can only pull the target 10 feet.

trait.name: Alcohol Sense
entries: The Borenbog can use an action to sense the direction to the nearest source of alcohol within 1 mile.

trait.name: Lucky Hands (2/Day)
entries: The Borenbog begins combat with two severed hands tacked to its belt. It might add more if it succeeds with its Take Hand feature, to a maximum of six. When it fails a saving throw or ability check, the Borenbog can rip one of the hands free as a free action to reroll.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Borenbog has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Quick Swig (2/Short Rest)
entries: The Borenbog uses a bonus action to drink from its magical gourd. The gourd (AC 18, 50 hit points, resistance to bludgeoning damage) it attached to a knotty leather cord around the Borenbog's neck. If the gourd is taken, the Borenbog cannot use this trait and does everything in its power to both get the gourd back and kill the creature who tried to take it. When it drinks, the Borenbog gains one of the following benefits of its choice:

items.name: Giant's Draught
entries: The Borenbog becomes Huge size, deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) with all melee weapon attacks, and on a successful melee attack it can choose to push its target 15 feet away.

items.name: Bayou Brew
entries: All ground within the area of the Borenbog's Stupefy Aura becomes swampy, transforming from hard surfaces into waterlogged spider webs and tangled roots suffused with negative energies. All other creatures treat the area as difficult terrain, taking 17 ({@damage 5d6}) necrotic damage at the end of their turn if they are in contact with the floor.

trait.name: Redundant Defence
entries: Any attack made against the Borenbog has no effect if the same type of weapon, elemental damage type (acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder), or specific spell affected it in the past 24 hours. For example, only one attack with a longsword can harm it per day, even if one is steel and one is silver. When the Borenbog takes ongoing damage, once that ongoing damage ends it cannot suffer that same type of ongoing damage for 24 hours.

trait.name: Stupefying Aura
entries: Hostile creatures entering or starting their turn within a 40-foot radius of the Borenbog must make a {@dc 20} Intelligence saving throw or be stupefied for one round. A stupefied creature can only use an action or bonus action each round (not both) and can only move at half speed. In addition, the only actions it can take are very uncreative like walking, making basic attacks, or casting cantrips. A creature that succeeds on its saving throw against this aura becomes immune to its effects for 24 hours.

When the Borenbog is reduced below half of its maximum hit points for the first time in a day, the aura surges with power. Creatures previously immune to the aura are subject to its effects again until they successfully save a second time.

trait.name: Take Hand
entries: If the Borenbog hits a stupefied creature twice in the same turn with its gutting knife, the Borenbog also cuts off one of the target's hands, impaling it onto a nail on the Borenbog's belt and increasing the uses of the Lucky Hands trait. A creature that loses its hand becomes immune to the Borenbog's stupefying aura, even after the trait resurges. The victim bleeds, taking damage equal to its level or challenge rating at the end of each of its turns. The bleeding ends if it receives magical healing, or if someone makes a {@dc 15} Medicine check as an action to staunch the wound.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Borenbog attacks four times: three times with Gutting Knife and once with either Slam or Entangling Spit.

action.name: Gutting Knife
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}).

action.name: Entangling Spit
entries: The Borenbog spits a glob of black saliva at a creature it can see within 150 feet. The target makes a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or takes 17 ({@damage 5d6}) acid damage and is {@condition restrained} until it takes an action to make a {@dc 18} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target's choice) to escape. At the start of its turn, a creature {@condition restrained} by Entangling Spit takes 17 ({@damage 5d6}) acid damage.

monster.name: Serpent-Maned Lion
languages: understands primordial and sylvan but can't speak

trait.name: Abnegation (1/Encounter)
entries: If the lion fails a saving throw, it can succeed instead. Alternatively, it can expend this feature to safely pass through conjurations and evocations until the end of its next turn, allowing it to completely ignore the effects of spells of those schools.

trait.name: Crepusculous and Adumbral
entries: The lion has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Its weapon attacks are magical. Magical darkness doesn't impede its darkvision. While the lion is bloodied, magical darkness seeps from its body in a 15-foot radius that moves with it.

trait.name: Crown of Asps
entries: The lion has advantage on Perception checks and on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition debilitated|LevelUp}, or knocked {@condition unconscious}.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the lion moves at least 20 feet straight towards a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the lion can make one claw attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Running Leap
entries: With a 10-foot running start, the lion can long jump up to 25 feet.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The lion makes two attacks: one Claw and one Flurry of Serpents.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d12 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Flurry of Serpents
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

bonus.name: Cacophonous Roar (1/Encounter)
entries: Each creature of the lion's choice that is within 500 feet and able to hear it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature that fails its saving throw by 5 or more is also {@condition staggered|LevelUp} for the same duration. Creatures in darkness have disadvantage on this saving throw. A {@condition frightened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.name: Shadowlisk

resist.note: while at least part of the shadowlisk is in dim light or darkness

languages: understands primordial and sylvan but can't speak

trait.name: Abnegation (1/Encounter)
entries: If the shadowlisk fails a saving throw, it can succeed instead. Alternatively, it can expend this feature to safely pass through conjurations and evocations until the end of its next turn, allowing it to completely ignore the effects of spells of those schools.

trait.name: Crepusculous and Adumbral
entries: The shadowlisk has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Its weapon attacks are magical. Magical darkness doesn't impede its darkvision. While the shadowlisk is bloodied, magical darkness seeps from its body in a 15-foot radius that moves with it.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The shadowlisk can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Mirage Bane
entries: Any creature that ends its turn in the shadowlisk's line of sight and within 120 feet has its true form revealed, ignoring any illusions or transmutations. Magical effects are not dispelled or suppressed, simply seen through.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shadowlisk chooses one of the following:

items: It makes two attacks - Claw and then Beak - and can use Gloaming Leap before, between, or after the attacks.
It makes a Claw attack, then uses Umbrafying Gaze.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}36 ({@damage 9d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}38 ({@damage 6d10 + 5}) piercing damage. It then uses the {@spell trip|LevelUp} maneuver on the target.

action.name: Gloaming Leap
entries: The shadowlisk magically teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. The shadowlisk cannot use this ability if its current location or destination are entirely brightly illuminated. When the shadowlisk teleports, any creature that is {@condition prone} and within 5 feet of it also teleports, arriving in an unoccupied space next to the shadowlisk.

action.name: Umbrafying Gaze
entries: The shadowlisk magically focuses the light from its eyes in a path that is 25 feet long and 5 feet wide. Creatures in the path must succeed on a {@dc 18} Charisma saving throw, taking 38 ({@damage 5d12 + 6}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by this damage is annihilated as its body burns away and its mind and soul are imprinted on the closest surface as a shadowy silhouette, suitable for consumption by shadowlisks. While it is annihilated in this way, a creature can perceive its immediate surroundings, but is {@condition incapacitated} and {@condition debilitated|LevelUp} and cannot communicate.

If a different creature coats its hands with the blood of a shadowlisk, it can touch the mind and soul of a creature that has been annihilated within the last day and restore its body as an action. A creature restored in this way is alive and stable, with 0 hit points.

reaction.name: Obtenebrating Escape (1/Encounter)
entries: If the shadowlisk would take damage, it uses Gloaming Leap. The shadowlisk does not suffer the triggering damage or any effects attached to it. The rea within 5 feet of the space it teleports to is covered in magical darkness until the end of the shadowlisk's next turn.

monster.name: Ten-Headed Lion
languages: understands elvish and sylvan but can't speak

trait.name: Dreamborn
entries: The lion doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep. It has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Its attacks are magical. It is aware of the location of each sleeping creature within 1 mile.

trait.name: Mandala Mane
entries: The lion's regal poise is glorified by an additional nine heads, whirling around the catlike creature in a maned mandala. These additional heads can fly freely within 150 feet of the body. If a head starts its turn farther away from the body than 150 feet, it teleports adjacent to the body, or is destroyed if it cannot teleport. Each head is a Small creature with 25 hit points. It has the same AC, saves, and immunities as the body, and can take its own reaction. However, if a damaging source with an area of effect would strike multilpe heads simultaneously, the damage is only dealt once and is divided equally amongst them. The heads can make the body's Bite attack.

The lion has advantage on Perception checks and saving throws against being {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition debilitated|LevelUp}, or knocked {@condition unconscious}.
If the lion has at least 1 hit point and starts its turn under any of the above conditions, it can destroy a head of its choice and end all those conditions.
Whenever a head is destroyed, the lion's maximum hit points are reduced by 25. The lion restores all of its heads as part of a long rest.

The body can attach itself to one of its heads without an action, at any time, simply by sharing a space. The body can also detach its current head without an action, at any time. It can operate just fine without a head.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The lion uses Denarian Dance four times and makes an attack with its claw. If Roiling Flame is available, the lion can use it in place of the claw attack.

action.name: Bite (Head Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage. If the target has already been bitten by another head this round, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 19}).

action.name: Claw (Body Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage. If the target is {@condition grappled} by a head, it is knocked {@condition prone} unless it succeeds a Strength saving throw ({@dc 19}).

action.name: Roiling Flame (Recharges 3 Rounds After Use)
entries: The ground within 150 feet of the lion is coated with flames. They linger, filling low elevations but not flowing uphill. Creatures in the area take 11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage immediately, as does any creature that enters the area.
At the start of the lion's next turn, the flames grow more intense, dealing 22 ({@damage 4d10}) fire damage immediately and to any creature that enters the area.
At the start of the lion's third turn the flames flash, dealing 44 ({@damage 8d10}) fire damage and then vanishing. At the end of that turn, this power recharges.

action.name: Denarian Dance
entries: One of the lion's heads flies up to 80 feet; the lion either makes a Bite attack with that head or uses that head's special action. Once the lion uses a specific head, that head cannot act again until the start of the lion's next turn. The special actions of the heads are as follows:

items.name: 1. Healing Tongue
entries: The head licks wounds upon the lion's body or a bodiless head. The head must be within 5 feet of the recipient. The recipient regains 14 ({@damage 4d6}) hit points.

items.name: 2. Entangling Exhalation
entries: The head exhales hot breath upon the ground, and dense foliage erupts around each creature of its choice in a 20-foot cone. Each creature must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} until the end of its next turn.

items.name: 3. Terrifying Roar
entries: The head roars at each creature of its choice in a 20-foot cone. Each creature must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened}. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. When it succeeds, the condition ends and it becomes immune to this roar for the next day.

items.name: 4. Petrifying Gaze
entries: The head locks eyes with a creature it can see within 10 feet of it, which must make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature begins to turn to stone and is {@condition restrained}. A creature may choose to shut its eyes at the start of its turn and keep them shut until the start of its next turn. If it does, the partial petrification ends.

If the creature is already partially petrified and it fails its save against this attack, it is {@condition petrified} until the lion is destroyed or the creature is freed by the {@spell greater restoration|LevelUp} spell or other magic.

items.name: 5. Gnashing Dispel
entries: THe head ganshes its teeth and uses {@spell dispel magic|LevelUp} with a range of 50 feet. Constitution is its spellcasting ability.

items.name: 6. Staggering Hunger
entries: The head licks its lips at a creature it can see within 10 feet of it, which must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition staggered|LevelUp} at the start of its next turn. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: 7. Venom Fangs
entries: Black ichor coats the fangs of the head as it makes a Bite attack against a creature within reach. If the attack hits, the creature is {@condition poisoned}. The creature can make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: 8. Radiant Beam
entries: Light lances out from the head's gaping mouth. The head makes a ranged spell attack with a +10 attack bonus against a creature within 50 feet. On a hit, the creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) radiant damage and is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.

items.name: 9. Steal Voice
entries: The head takes a deep breath, which agonises the tongue of a creature it can see within 10 feet of it. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw or be cursed, unable to speak above a croaking whisper until the curse is removed or the lion is destroyed.

Until the target recovers its voice, all of the lion's heads can perfectly imitate it, and the lion instinctively knows how to use this voice to trick others. Whenever the target casts a spell with a verbal component, it can attempt a {@dc 15} Arcana check. If it fails, it expends the spell slot without casting the spell.

items.name: 10. Snarling Hurl
entries: The head bares its fangs at a Huge or smaller creature it can see within 10 feet of it. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be moved up to 30 feet in any direction, including upward. Until the end of the creature's next turn, the creature is {@condition restrained} by a telekinetic force. A creature lifted upward is suspended in midair. The creature might fall once it is no longer {@condition restrained}.

Alternatively, the tenth head can try to move an object that weighs up to 1,000 pounds it can see within 10 feet of it, as per the {@spell telekinesis|LevelUp} spell. Constitution is its spellcasting ability.

legendary.name: Direct the Pride
entries: The lion uses Denarian Dance two times.

legendary.name: Fading Leap
entries: The lion's body detaches its current head (if any), then magically teleports up to 120 feet to a space occupied by one of its heads. That head then attaches to the body.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The notturna's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

2e: {@spell animate objects|LevelUp} (it must spend an action painting each object it wants to animate)

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The notturna has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Superior Invisibility
entries: The notturna turns magically {@condition invisible} until its concentration on this effect ends.

monster.name: Witchoil Automaton
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Bleak Aura
entries: The automaton's weapon attacks are magical, and some of the automaton's attacks can afflict a creature with its Bleak Aura. At the start of the automaton's turn, each afflicted creature and each creature within 10 feet of an afflicted creature takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) necrotic damage. However, that creature's weapon attacks count as magical for the purpose of harming the automaton. A creature can remove the Bleak Aura from itself by immersing in water, taking fire damage, or spending an action to wipe the oil off.

trait.name: Witchoil Ward
entries: The automaton has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects. Ranged attacks against it that originate more than 20 feet away have disadvantage. If those attacks already have disadvantage from being at long range, they automatically miss.

trait.name: Witchoil Breach
entries: When the automaton is first reduced to 30 hit points or fewer, its souleater engine ruptures in a powerful explosion. Each creature within 20 feet takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage, or half as much if it succeeds a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw. Each creature in the area is afflicted by the automaton's Bleak Aura. Thereafter, the automaton's speed increases to 40 feet, and it gains a climb speed of 40 feet, but it loses Witchoil Ward and its Witchoil Fist attack no longer inflicts a Bleak Aura.

trait.name: Technological Weakness
entries: Whenever a creature proficient in either Engineering or Arcana enters combat with a hostile automaton, it knows that the automaton has weaknesses. As a bonus action, the creature can make either a {@dc 13} Arcana or Engineering check, having the DM read out either the automaton's Howl of Souls or Cold Fragility trait, respectively, on a success.

trait.name: Howl of Souls
entries: Magic that would heal the automaton instead deals an equal amount of damage. The restorative energy briefly empowers the souls in the witchoil engine, and they fight against the wards holding them in. The automaton's Bleak Aura does no damage on its next turn.

trait.name: Cold Fragility
entries: When the automaton takes cold damage, if any single attack deals 15 or more bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage to it in the next turn, this triggers Witchoil Breach (regardless of how many hit points the automaton has) if it hasn't already triggered.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The automaton makes two attacks.

action.name: Witchoil Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and the target is afflicted by the automaton's Bleak Aura.

action.name: Smash Aside
entries: The automaton throws an object of up to Medium size. {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 20 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the automaton hit a Medium or smaller creature with its Witchoil Fist this turn, when it uses this attack it throws that creature. If it hits with the attack, the thrown creature also takes 9 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Flayed Jaguar
languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Abnegation (1/Encounter)
entries: If the jaguar fails a saving throw, it can succeed instead. Alternatively, it can expend this to safely pass through conjurations and evocations until the end of its next turn, allowing it to completely ignore the effects of those schools of magic.

trait.name: Crepusculous and Adumbral
entries: The jaguar has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Its weapon attacks are magical. Magical darkness doesn't impede its darkvision.

trait.name: Cursed Blood
entries: Whenever the jaguar takes piercing or slashing damage, it sprays out dark blood. Each creature within 5 feet of the jaguar cannot regain hit points until the end of its next turn. Additionally, until the end of the jaguar's next turn, each space it moves through becomes contaminated difficult terrain until it is scrubbed clean. Each time a creature enters this contaminated difficult terrain or ends its turn there, it cannot regain hit points until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The jaguar has advantage on Perception checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: No Escape
entries: If the jaguar hits with an opportunity attack, the target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Volatile Existence
entries: When the jaguar is reduced to 0 hit points, it dies. Any witchoil it had that is not ensouled degenerates into regular oil; its ensouled witchoil can still be gathered up.

trait.name: Technological Weakness
entries: Whenever a creature proficient in either Arcana or Insight enters combat with a hostile jaguar, it knows that the jaguar has weaknesses. As a bonus action, the creature can make either a {@dc 12} Arcana or Insight check, having the DM read out either the jaguar's Witchoil Heart or Command Collar trait, respectively, on a success.

trait.name: Witchoil Heart
entries: If the jaguar's speed is 0, a creature within reach can spend an action to attempt a {@dc 13} Strength check to remove the steel plate covering the jaguar's heart. On a success, the jaguar takes 10 points of radiant damage at the start of each of its turns, and the next attack that deals damage to the jaguar kills it.

trait.name: Command Collar
entries: A creature grappling the jaguar can grab its collar and spend a bonus action to attempt a {@dc 13} Charisma (Animal Handling) check. On a success, for 1 minute, the jaguar is {@condition charmed} by the creature that subjugated it and obeys that creature's verbal commands, though it will defend itself if attacked, ignoring any commands.

While the jaguar is {@condition charmed} in this way, the character who {@condition charmed} it can remove its witchoil heart or safely open it to refill it with ensouled witchoil. If a character does so, the jaguar becomes loyal to the character for a week.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The jaguar makes two Claw attacks. If the target is {@condition prone}, it also makes a Bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d12 + 2}) piercing damage. If the target is a {@condition prone} Large or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}), and the jaguar cannot bite another target until this grapple ends.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

monster.name: Shadow Hound Killer
languages: one based on the killer's race

trait.name: Abnegation (1/Encounter)
entries: If the killer fails a saving throw, it can succeed instead. Alternatively, it can expend this to safely pass through conjurations and evocations until the end of its next turn, allowing it to completely ignore the effects of those schools of magic.

trait.name: Crepusculous and Adumbral
entries: The killer has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Its weapon attacks are magical. Magical darkness doesn't impede its darkvision.

trait.name: Technological Weakness
entries: Whenever a creature proficient in Religion enters combat with a hostile killer, it knows that the killer has a weakness. As a bonus action, the creature can make a {@dc 12} Religion check, having the DM read out the killer's Hideous Reveal trait on a success.

trait.name: Hideous Reveal
entries: Whenever the killer takes radiant damage or ends its turn in a brightly-lit area, the killer's matte, black skin fades, revealing for a moment raw muscle and sinew and weeping rivulets of blood. The killer becomes visible if it previously hid with Hide in Shadows. Additionally, until the end of its next turn it loses its damage resistance and cannot use Hide in Shadows or Draw the Dark Veil Shut.

action.name: Claw of Shadow
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage. If the target is a living creature and it takes any damage from this attack, its life is linked to the Realm of the Dead, and it bleeds copiously, feeling a terrible chill. While linked this way, it cannot heal hit points. Additionally, it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage at the start of each of its turns. Its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. The link lasts until the creature ends its turn in a brightly-lit area, or until a creature spends an action and makes a {@dc 10} Medicine check to staunch the bleeding.

bonus.name: Hide in Shadows
entries: The killer casts {@spell darkness|LevelUp}, then becomes {@condition invisible} if it is in an area of dim light or darkness, and it remains {@condition invisible} until it attacks, enters a brightly-lit area, or takes radiant damage. Its spellcasting ability for this action is Charisma.

reaction.name: Draw the Black Veil Shut (1/Encounter)
entries: When an attack damages the killer, it uses Hide in Shadows and then teleports 30 feet to a location it can see.
